Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: clean-cut adj 1: (of persons) neat and smart in appearance; "a clean-cut and well-bred young man"; "the trig corporal in his jaunty cap" [syn: {trig}, {trim}] 2: clear and distinct to the senses; easily perceptible; "as clear as a whistle"; "clear footprints in the snow"; "the letter brought back a clear image of his grandfather"; "a spire clean-cut against the sky"; "a clear-cut pattern" [syn: {clear}, {clear-cut}]
